intro: Buchnera exserta, commonly known as the narrow-leafed buckler-vice, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, two-lipped flowers that are typically pale blue or violet in color. Buchnera exserta is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and adaptability to various garden conditions.
